data.title: Tasty INDEED
data.text: The food here is some kind of womderful, I've actually had the oxtails with rice/peas and the chicken with rice. The bread is so delicious.  The atmosphere is friendly and the staff is great.  I love to try new things so I tried the drink (begins with  T - LOL, they tell me it's made out of beans well I couldn't tell) and it was excellent! Try it I guarantee you'll go back!

data.title: A pleasant taste of Africa
data.text: Excellent food.  The wait staff was great in making suggestions and helping us make a good food choice.  Will definitely return.

data.title: Great food
data.text:
Very clean place.
Great food with wonderful  west africa flavors. No problems with the parking on week days.

data.title: Oh My God - You are Kidding Me, Right?
data.text: Hands down the most interesting and tasty restaurant in Fayetteville! C'mon, where is your sense of adventure, right? Never had a clue what "West African" food even consisted of, but don't worry - no giraffes or lions on the menu. The soups and meals are extraordinary - great consistency, smell, taste, and spices. The service is understated and friendly. On a warm day, you can sit outside and watch people walk by (OK, make that a warm weekend day!). Definitely a must try on any visit to Fayetteville...

data.title: So glad I tried it
data.text: The oxtails are amazing and so are the owners. This is a treat, the food is so good and you can eat outside and people watch.

data.title: Good Service and good Food
data.text: Nice restaurant.  The decor is traditional West African and the food is delicious.  The building is relatively small but holds a nice lunch crowd.  In walking distance to other shops and restaurants.

data.title: Night of dancing in the street
data.text: Excellent cuisine from a wide variety of West African specialties. The dancing was absolutely fabulous by Mr. Ramon & Mrs. Cora.

data.title: Amazing!
data.text: Like another reviewer stated, "just. eat. here!" I like trying new places and I do not like chain restaurants; Taste of West Africa was wonderful! The food is great, the atmosphere is great and, best of all, owners are great!! If you go away from here hungry it is your own fault.

data.title: Pleasantly Surprised
data.text: I was pleasantly surprised by the food.  This family owned-operated restaurant is a gem.  The food is authentic, well-seasoned and tasty.  The personal service is an added bonus.  Don't sleep on this one!

data.title: Just. Eat. Here.
data.text: Having lived in South Africa for a time, this place felt like home! The goat is amazingly tender. If you have the time, get the "Indeginous Meal", it is quite simply worth it.

data.title: A fresh taste
data.text:
Who would have guessed you would find a restaurant offering dishes from Ghana in the heart of downtown Fayetteville! We stopped at a hotel for the night, skipping scores of fast food options for supper. 

My husband ordered the peanut butter soup with chicken that we devoured. He had a beef stew with beans and rice and I had the goat stew. Both served with plantains. So much food! The large soup was $9.99 which I considered a meal with pieces of broccoli, cauliflower, carrots and more in a savory soup. Stews were good...around $14. No veggies though.  My glass of wine was $4. 
Small place, maybe 12 tables and booths. Friendly, modest.

data.title: The real deal
data.text: Having had the opportunity to travel to the African continent a few times, this was a delight. It is a very simple place but an experience. The owners and staff are very friendly and welcoming, much like the people of Africa. The food is very authentic and delicious. It brought back memories to have an ice cold Tusker beer. I will come back to the next time I pass through Fayetteville and recommend that if you want to try something unique and delicious...try the taste of West Africa.

data.title: Excellent taste of Africa!
data.text: Like the name rightly says, this is a great place to taste African dishes. The dishes, be it egusi soup, okra soup and others will take you straight to Africa! Very neat and friendly management. Will recommend to all who want a taste of Africa.

data.title: West African Experience
data.text: Fantastic experience! The food was off the chain.  It was fresh and not pre-prepared.  Waiting for the food was certainly worth it! The staff is friendly and warm.

data.title: Friendly, family-run business!
data.text: Ask their advice on dishes, then take their advice!  We eat a chicken dish, with rice, spinach, interesting spices---I get it hotter than my wife; plantains on the side + ethnic beers!

data.title: So good!!! Just what we were looking for.....
data.text: Fresh food, unique flavors and outstanding service. My kids like their food as well . The empanadas  where their favorite. They love the chicken and the owner was so sweet to bring them a little extra. What a treat not too far off 95.

data.title: Great food in a perfect friendly family environment
data.text: What can I say the owners are great members of the community who have their doors always open. The always welcome you in a warm hearted manner with an amazing smile. Tee is the owner and operator alongside his beautiful wife. Their staff is great and always willing to go above and beyond. Can't go wrong great food and a at home feeling. It's like mamas cooking!

data.title: Unique menu, homestyle atmosphere, terrific service
data.text: Taste of West Africa is not what you'd call a five-star restaurant by any stretch, but the food is so good and wholesome, and the staff so friendly, and the atmosphere so inviting and relaxing, that I had to give this restaurant top marks. What can I say about the food? It's its own genre. Everything is unique, and the descriptions so appetizing, that you want to try everything! If you don't know where to start, ask the staff and they'll give you a recommendation that won't disappoint. My wife and I split a two-person appetizer and it was plenty of food for us. We'll definitely come back next time we're in town.

data.title: Pass the Foo Foo Please. Vegan Menu.
data.text:
I've always wanted to try West African cuisine and this restaurant did not disappoint.

We called in our order on the way (they ask you give 30 or so minutes for them to prepare the indigenous specials). We got foo foo with peanut soup. The portions were huge! 

Really delicious and fresh tasting. We ended up with a pretty decent amount of leftovers. 

Tips: Restaurant was pretty warm inside (it was also very hot out). Portions are large, you can definitely share.

data.title: Date night
data.text: Food was good.  Wait staff was short but they could have been having a bad night.  It happens. They messed up our order as well.
